page.title: 13A WALK FROM NEWLAY TO RODLEY
page.content: This walk is part of the Kirkstall Valley Trail. We left school and went down to Newlay Bridge, built in 1819. We continued across the bridge over the Leeds to Carlise railway line. Through a field we came to the Leeds and Liverpool canal. We walked along the tow path , under bridge number 221 looking at grooves worn by the horse drawn barges. We walked past Fallwood Marina and a swingbridge. We went past many old mills and a large crane works. Continuing along the footpath we passed through Rodley, under the A6120 Ring Road bridge and down along the tow path still to turn up and go over the old Packhorse bridge across the River Aire. We took a footpath turning right to walk back along the north bank of the river through Thornton wood across the railway back to school
